Issues.Title: Fix build when using source generators (#6534)
Issues.Body:
Fixes dotnet/wpf#6522
Fixes https://github.com/dotnet/roslyn/issues/60257

## Description
Fixes the build when using source generators.

## Customer Impact
Without this PR, customers cannot build a WPF application with source generators.

## Regression
No. To my knowledge, it never worked.

## Testing
Tested by building a blank WPF application that uses the Regex source generator. This PR fixed the build.

## Risk
Low.

/cc @RussKie (It looks like your hunch about the `Analyzers` property was right)

Issues.Title: Remove sealed from all AutomationPeers.
Issues.Body:
Hello,

Some AutomationPeers such as the DataGridRowAutomationPeer are sealed. It would be better if these were not sealed. For example, if a specific DataGridRow is created with additional parameters, we could derive from DataGridRowAutomationPeer and then add these parameters to the new AutomationPeer. But this is not possible if they are sealed.

Greetings

Andreas
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Remove sealed from all AutomationPeers." (#6674)

Issues.Title: wpf incorrect binding logic
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 6.0.3
* Windows version: 21H2
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: don't know
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)? If yes, please file the issue via the instructions [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/ide/how-to-report-a-problem-with-visual-studio?view=vs-2019).
* Security issues and bugs should be reported privately, learn more via our [responsible disclosure guidelines](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/main/README.md#reporting-security-issues-and-security-bugs).

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/main/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**
Having two UC with dependency properties.
The WPF binding isn't working as expected when binding a dependency property to another one from another usercontrol.
 
 **Actual behavior:**
using this in UC1
<local:UserControl2 Margin="50,0" ColorRectangle="{Binding ColorRectangleUC1}"/>
the binding
 is setting up on the data context of UC2.
 
 **Expected behavior:**
the binding should set up on the data context of UC1
 
 **Minimal repro:**
[WpfApp12022-06-07_11-35-41.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/8852045/WpfApp12022-06-07_11-35-41.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "wpf incorrect binding logic" (#6658)

Issues.Title: A11y_VS User Story 1350938_Account Options_Add new Account_Keyboard: When the user closes the 'Sign In' dialog with escape key, the focus disappears from the screen and on using 'tab' key, the focus lands on 'Learn More' link.
Issues.Body:
**GitHubTags:**#A11yMAS;#A11yTCS;#A11ySev2;#DesktopApp;#WCAG2.4.3;#Keyboard;#Win32;#LinkedBug;#BM-.NetCore(WPF)-Win32-July2021;#.NET Core;

## Environment Details:
Application Name: Microsoft Visual Studio Enterprise 2022 (64-bit) - main
Windows Version: Win11

## Repro Steps:

1. Open Visual studio.
2. Tab till 'File' Menu item and hit enter on it.  
3. Tab till Account Setting and hit enter on it.
4. Tab till 'Add' button and hit enter on it. 
5. 'Sign In' dialog will open.
6. Close the dialog using keyboard and observe the focus order return.

## Actual:
When the user closes the 'Sign In' dialog with escape key, the focus disappears from the screen and on using 'tab' key, the focus lands on 'Learn More' link.

## Expected:
When the user closes the 'Sign In' dialog, the focus should return to the 'Add' button and should be visible to the users.

## User Impact:
Users with visual impairments will get wrong order of navigation

## Attachment:
![Presentation1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/98393966/172607053-d866de4f-855f-44fb-bac3-98679c627b97.gif)
